svg.text:
title: "Week in Ethereum News
January 8, 2017" date: "2017-01-08"
News and Links
Top
* Status.im alpha is out and getting rave reviews It’s still buggy: blog post on known
bugs (also: they’re hiring!) To understand how huge this could be, I recommend this
FastCo article on WeChat in China RELATED: Introduction of the Light Client for Dapp
developers
Status.im alpha is out and getting rave reviews
* It’s still buggy: blog post on known bugs (also: they’re hiring!)
It’s still buggy: blog post on known bugs (also: they’re hiring!)
* To understand how huge this could be, I recommend this FastCo article on WeChat in
China
To understand how huge this could be, I recommend this FastCo article on WeChat in
* RELATED: Introduction of the Light Client for Dapp developers
RELATED: Introduction of the Light Client for Dapp developers
* Etherplay also went live on the mainchain, and people are talking about how they
can’t stop playing . An interview with Ronan from Etherplay
Etherplay also went live on the mainchain, and people are talking about how they can’t
stop playing .
* An interview with Ronan from Etherplay
Stuff for Dapp developers
* EVM formalization for interactive theorem provers , v 0.0.1 More Yoichi Hirai:
Measuring the VM Test’s Coverage with the Lem Model
EVM formalization for interactive theorem provers , v 0.0.1
* More Yoichi Hirai:
* Developers guide: Mobile account management by Péter Szilágyi
Developers guide: Mobile account management by Péter Szilágyi
* EthOn – organized Ethereum knowledge. Very cool visual aids.
EthOn – organized Ethereum knowledge. Very cool visual aids.
* Hosting a DNS domain on Ethereum – also worth reading the comment thread Fully
decentralized ENS tracking Dapp from the RexMLS team
Hosting a DNS domain on Ethereum – also worth reading the comment thread
* Fully decentralized ENS tracking Dapp from the RexMLS team
* Open Zeppelin v1.0.1 secure Solidity framework released
Open Zeppelin v1.0.1 secure Solidity framework released
Ecosystem
* Announcing MyEtherWallet v3.4 : The Node Switcher
* uPort is hiring 9 people – looks like they closed a fundraising round?
* Taylor Gerring’s Windows Installer for Mist: test release 1
* Shopping carts without servers on Ethereum
* Ethereum is “the most likely candidate” to become the global payment network –
Coinbase’s Brian Armstrong
* Coindesk published an article about ‘Enterprise Ethereum’ Joe Lubin : Meeting was of
a “bunch of companies, large and small … [who want to] ensur[e] that core public
Ethereum is strong and well resourced and that the roadmap towards 2.0 and beyond has
the best talent available to execute it.” I feel like if you read this newsletter, you
probably had a decent idea already that this was true. Go read the whole comment thread
– at least a couple of folks working on private chain corporate projects attesting to
the fact that the long-term future will be public chains
* Joe Lubin : Meeting was of a “bunch of companies, large and small … [who want to]
ensur[e] that core public Ethereum is strong and well resourced and that the roadmap
towards 2.0 and beyond has the best talent available to execute it.”
* I feel like if you read this newsletter, you probably had a decent idea already that
this was true.
* Go read the whole comment thread – at least a couple of folks working on private
chain corporate projects attesting to the fact that the long-term future will be public
chains
Project Updates
* “ We put a Tesla on the Ethereum Block chain ” – Project Oaken put one of their
ACORNs in a Tesla for a prototype of a toll road system that runs on Ethereum. As they
say, the use cases go far beyond tolls If I were a VC, I’d be pretty much begging them
to take my money (and let me lead the round too?)
“ We put a Tesla on the Ethereum Block chain ” – Project Oaken put one of their ACORNs
in a Tesla for a prototype of a toll road system that runs on Ethereum. As they say,
the use cases go far beyond tolls
* If I were a VC, I’d be pretty much begging them to take my money (and let me lead the
round too?)
* uPort has sent out the first invites to its alpha State Change podcast: uPort
uPort has sent out the first invites to its alpha
* State Change podcast: uPort
* Tendermint: why we’re building Cosmos, the Internet of Blockchains
Tendermint: why we’re building Cosmos, the Internet of Blockchains
* Arthur Falls talks to post-Christopher David Arcade City
Arthur Falls talks to post-Christopher David Arcade City
* FundRequest: The road to a self-sustaining platform
FundRequest: The road to a self-sustaining platform
* HackerGold’s HKG token has a bug . It will need a reissue OpenZeppelin’s security
review recommended changes that would’ve prevented the bug
HackerGold’s HKG token has a bug . It will need a reissue
* OpenZeppelin’s security review recommended changes that would’ve prevented the bug
Stuff for Beginners and Non-experts
* How to explain Ethereum to web developers
* Here’s the video of the talk at TicketLeap I gave on Ethereum . Slides are in the
video description.
* If you’ve wondered how Ethereum’s block time is so low, /u/doloto gave a fantastic
explanation of GHOST and uncles
* Jez San had some interesting comments about PoW in this thread.
* Nate Rush on gas accounting .
General
* Building payroll system in Ethereum blockchain, what did we learn? Pretty good
overview of how to think about blockchains
Building payroll system in Ethereum blockchain, what did we learn?
* Pretty good overview of how to think about blockchains
* VentureBeat: Blockchain could completely transform the music industry
VentureBeat: Blockchain could completely transform the music industry
* Podcast interview of Cornell’s Ari Juels: Using Hardware Enclaves to Provide Trusted
Data to Smart Contracts
Podcast interview of Cornell’s Ari Juels: Using Hardware Enclaves to Provide Trusted
* Jeffrey Berns files his response to legal chicanery by the IRS in the Coinbase case
Jeffrey Berns files his response to legal chicanery by the IRS in the Coinbase case
* Someone screwed up and paid nearly $8k to make a transfer in early December.
Dwarfpool did the charitable thing and refunded.
Someone screwed up and paid nearly $8k to make a transfer in early December. Dwarfpool
did the charitable thing and refunded.
Dates of note
* Jan 17 – iEx.ec token sale begins
* Jan 23 – Intellisys private equity “Mainstreet fund ” sale begins
* Jan 27-29 – Thomson Reuters “Hack the Valley” hackathon
* Feb 6 – FundRequest sale begins
* Feb 15 – Chronobank sale ends
* Feb 15 – Melonport sale begins (must check a box that you aren’t US Citizen)
* Feb 17-18 – Ethereum Euro Dev Conference in Paris
[I aim for a relatively comprehensive list of Ethereum sales, but make no warranty as
to even whether they are legit; as such, I thus likewise warrant nothing about whether
any will produce a satisfactory return. This is not investment advice.]
Sharing
If this issue was useful to you, would you share it on social media or email it to a
friend?
Link: http://www.weekinethereum.com/post/155563978128/january-8-2017
Just in case you want to send Ether (or tokens?):
0x96d4F0E75ae86e4c46cD8e9D4AE2F2309bD6Ec45
Week in Ethereum News
